case_vignette: A 15-YEAR-OLD WHITE ADOLESCENT PRESENTS TO THE DERMATOLOGY CLINIC WITH AN ASYMPTOMATIC RASH ON HIS UPPER BACK THAT HAS PERSISTED FOR 4 MONTHS. PHYSICAL EXAMINATION REVEALS HYPERPIGMENTED SCALY PAPULES COALESCING INTO CONFLUENT PLAQUES WITH PERIPHERAL RETICULATED PAPILLOMATOSIS. THE BOY IS OVERWEIGHT BUT HAS NO HISTORY OF ANY OTHER MEDICAL CONDITIONS.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have a rash on my upper back that has been there for about 4 months.
Can you describe the appearance of the rash? Is it itchy, scaly, or blistering?
The rash is scaly, but it's not itchy or blistering.
Has the rash changed in size or spread to other areas since you first noticed it?
No, it has not spread to other areas.
Do you have a history of prolonged sun exposure or use of tanning beds?
No, I do not have a history of prolonged sun exposure or use of tanning beds.
Have you ever had this type of rash before, or do you have any chronic skin conditions?
No, I have never had this type of rash before and I do not have any chronic skin conditions.
Are you currently taking any medications, and have you started any new medications in the past year?
No, I am not currently taking any medications and have not started any new medications in the past year.
Do you have a family history of any skin conditions or autoimmune diseases?
No, I do not have a family history of any skin conditions or autoimmune diseases.
Final Diagnosis: Tinea Versicolor
